result.execSummary:
The defendant Tiffany Michelle Seawright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Bond of $200 applied to DNA/Court costs. Balance due with payment plan of $25 per mo commencing 11/1/2022. Failure to pay may result in a civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tiffany Michelle Seawright

Defendant Tiffany Michelle Seawright appeared by video, in custody from the Ozaukee County Jail with Atty Heather Dvoran as a friend of the court. Counsel acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading. Defendant does not qualify for PD Representation. Court reviews charges/penalties and finds probable cause.
